summary.suggested_edit: Update the 2025 Formula One season section to confirm Lando Norris clinched his first World Drivers' Championship by finishing third at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, as reported by The Athletic. Replace the previous status about leading into final races with details of the championship win.
summary.original_text: As of November 25, 2025, Norris maintains the championship lead with a 24-point advantage over both Piastri and Verstappen heading into the final races.

summary.suggested_edit: The page already reflects the news; verify and cite the Breaking News tweet from The Athletic: Inter Miami won its first MLS Cup title with Lionel Messi’s assists in a 3-1 win against Vancouver.
summary.original_text: On December 6, 2025, Inter Miami CF won its first MLS Cup, defeating Vancouver Whitecaps FC 3-1 in the final at Chase Stadium in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. Lionel Messi provided two assists in the match and was named MLS Cup MVP.

summary.suggested_edit: Add to recent developments: A man from Florida was charged with killing a woman whose body was found close to her slain child near Gilgo Beach on Long Island; his case doesn’t appear to be linked to the New York serial killings.
summary.original_text: In April 2025, Nassau County police identified two long-unidentified victims whose remains were discovered in Freeport in 1997: a woman known as "Peaches" due to a distinctive tattoo, and a nearby toddler dubbed "Baby Doe." The woman was determined to be Tanya Denise Jackson, aged 26, and the child her daughter, Tatiana Marie Dykes, approximately 2 years old; ... officials stated there is no forensic or circumstantial evidence connecting these deaths to the Gilgo Beach murders or Heuermann.

summary.suggested_edit: Add to Role at Apple section: Apple’s chip chief Johny Srouji informed CEO Tim Cook he is seriously considering leaving the company and would likely continue his career elsewhere rather than retire. Apple is urgently pushing to keep him. He remains at least for now.
summary.original_text: Johny Srouji is an Israeli-American technology executive who serves as Apple's senior vice president of Hardware Technologies, a role he has held since 2015.

summary.suggested_edit: Update the Elseworlds section on The Penguin: DC Studios is now actively developing THE PENGUIN Season 2.
summary.original_text: A second season of The Penguin remains in discussion, potentially delving further into Gotham's criminal underbelly, though no official greenlight has been confirmed as of late 2025.

summary.suggested_edit: Add to Legal Proceedings section: A federal judge in Florida approved the release of grand jury documents from a nearly 20-year-old investigation of Jeffrey Epstein, beginning the process of making another batch of material about Epstein public.
summary.original_text: A Palm Beach County grand jury in June 2006 heard testimony revealing Epstein's sexual interactions with girls as young as 14 but indicted him only on one misdemeanor solicitation of prostitution charge, reflecting what investigators viewed as unduly narrow focus by state prosecutors.

summary.suggested_edit: Confirm and cite the death date as December 5, 2025, at age 96, matching breaking news reports.
summary.original_text: Frank Owen Gehry (born February 28, 1929 – died December 5, 2025) was a Canadian-born American architect and founder of Gehry Partners, LLP, based in Los Angeles, whose work emphasized sculptural forms, unconventional materials like corrugated metal and chain-link fencing, and contextual responsiveness to create buildings that challenge orthodox design principles.

summary.suggested_edit: Add to recent coverage or note that The Athletic broke news on Lando Norris' F1 championship and Inter Miami MLS Cup win.
summary.original_text: The Athletic is a subscription-based digital sports media company founded in 2016 by Alex Mather and Adam Hansmann, focusing on in-depth, ad-free journalism covering professional leagues such as the NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, and Premier League, as well as college sports.
